{
  "topic": "Mixed Series (Alphanumeric)",
  "question": "P4R, Q7T, R10V, S13X, _____",
  "choices": ["A) A) T16Z", "B) B) T16Y", "C) C) U19Z", "D) D) U19Y"],
  "answer": "B",
  "explanation": "First letters progress alphabetically: P, Q, R, S, T. The numbers increase by 3 each time: 4, 7, 10, 13, 16. The third letters follow the sequence R, T, V, X, Y (alternating vowels and consonants). Hence T16Y."
}

{
  "topic": "Syllogisms",
  "question": "Statement I: All dogs are mammals Statement II: Some mammals are birds Statement III: No bird is a reptile Conclusion I: Some dogs are birds Conclusion II: No reptile is a dog",
  "choices": ["A) If only conclusion II follows", "B) If only conclusion I follows", "C) If conclusion I and II both follow", "D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows"],
  "answer": "A",
  "explanation": "Conclusion II is valid as no bird is a reptile and all dogs are mammals, so no reptile is a dog. Conclusion I is invalid as no direct link between dogs and birds exists."
}

{
  "topic": "Syllogisms",
  "question": "Statement I: All books are novels Statement II: No novel is a magazine Statement III: Some magazines are papers Conclusion I: Some papers are novels Conclusion II: No book is a magazine",
  "choices": ["A) If only conclusion I follow", "B) If only conclusion II follows", "C) If conclusion I and II both follow", "D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows"],
  "answer": "B",
  "explanation": "All books are novels and no novel is a magazine directly imply no book is a magazine. Conclusion I is not valid as there's no link between papers and novels."
}

{
  "topic": "Family tree logic",
  "question": "Rahul says, 'She is the daughter of my mother’s only son.’ How is the woman related to Rahul?",
  "choices": ["A) A) Sister", "B) B) Cousin", "C) C) Aunt", "D) D) Mother"],
  "answer": "A",
  "explanation": "Rahul's mother's only son is Rahul himself. The daughter of Rahul is his sister. Therefore, the woman is Rahul's sister."
}

{
  "topic": "Family tree logic",
  "question": "Rohan says, 'My mother’s only brother’s daughter is the wife of my uncle’s son.’ How is the woman related to Rohan?",
  "choices": ["A) A) Cousin", "B) B) Sister", "C) C) Aunt", "D) D) Niece"],
  "answer": "D",
  "explanation": "Rohan's mother's only brother is Rohan's uncle. His daughter is Rohan's aunt. The wife of Rohan's uncle's son is Rohan's aunt's daughter, making her Rohan's niece."
}

{
  "topic": "Syllogisms",
  "question": "Statement I: All doctors are humans Statement II: Some humans are animals Statement III: All animals are mammals Conclusion I: Some mammals are doctors Conclusion II: All doctors are mammals",
  "choices": ["A) If only conclusion I follow", "B) If only conclusion II follows", "C) If conclusion I and II both follow", "D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows"],
  "answer": "B",
  "explanation": "All doctors are humans and all humans are animals, so all doctors are mammals. Conclusion I is not necessarily true as the overlap between mammals and doctors is not definite."
}

{
  "topic": "Mixed Series (Alphanumeric)",
  "question": "K7M, L8N, M9O, N10P, _____",
  "choices": ["A) A) O11Q", "B) B) P12O", "C) C) N11P", "D) D) O11Q"],
  "answer": "D",
  "explanation": "First letters progress alphabetically: K, L, M, N, O. Second letters are in alphabetical order: 7, 8, 9, 10, 11. Third letters follow the sequence: M, N, O, P, Q. Hence O11Q."
}

{
  "topic": "Seating Arrangements (Linear, Circular)",
  "question": "In a circular table with 8 people, A, B, C, D, E, F, G, and H are seated. A is directly opposite F. B is seated between C and D. E is seated three seats to the left of G. H is seated two seats to the right of A. If the person seated three seats to the left of B is swapped with the person seated two seats to the right of E, who is now seated directly opposite G?",
  "choices": ["A) C", "B) D", "C) E", "D) H"],
  "answer": "B",
  "explanation": "Original seating: A-F-G-E-D-C-B-H. After swap, positions become A-F-H-E-D-C-B-G. G is now opposite D."
}

{
  "topic": "Family tree logic",
  "question": "Ravi says, 'She is the daughter of my mother’s only brother’s daughter.’ How is the woman related to Ravi?",
  "choices": ["A) A) Sister", "B) B) Cousin", "C) C) Niece", "D) D) Aunt"],
  "answer": "B",
  "explanation": "Ravi's mother's only brother is Ravi's uncle. The daughter of his uncle is Ravi's aunt or cousin. Since the woman is the daughter of his uncle's daughter, she is Ravi's cousin."
}

{
  "topic": "Seating Arrangements (Linear, Circular)",
  "question": "In a circular table with 8 people, each seated with exactly one neighbor on either side, the following statements are true: A is seated between B and F; C is seated opposite D; E is seated two seats to the left of G; H is seated directly between F and G. If G moves two seats clockwise and B moves one seat counterclockwise, who is now seated between E and H?",
  "choices": ["A) A) B", "B) B) C", "C) C) D", "D) D) F"],
  "answer": "C",
  "explanation": "Original seating: B-A-F-H-G-E-D-C. After movement: G moves to position 3, B moves to position 6. New seating: B-6, A-1, F-2, H-3, G-4, E-5, D-7, C-8. E is at 5, H at 3. Between them is D at 4."
}

  "choices": ["A) A) V8X", "B) B) V8X", "C) C) W9Y", "D) D) X10Z"],
  "answer": "B",
  "explanation": "First letters progress alphabetically: R, S, T, U, V. Second letters also progress alphabetically: T, U, V, W, X. Numbers increase by 1 each time: 4, 5, 6, 7, 8. Hence V8X."
}

  "question": "There are eight people seated around a circular table, facing the center. A is seated between B and C. D is seated opposite A. E is seated two seats to the left of D.   "choices": ["A) A", "B) B", "C) C", "D) D"],
  "answer": "D",
  "explanation": "The seating order clockwise is B, A, C, D, H, F, E, G. G is opposite D."
}

{
  "topic": "Syllogisms",
  "question": "Statement I: All mammals are animals Statement II: Some animals are birds Statement III: All birds are reptiles Conclusion I: Some reptiles are mammals Conclusion II: Some mammals are reptiles",
  "choices": ["A) If only conclusion I follow", "B) If only conclusion II follows", "C) If conclusion I and II both follow", "D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows"],
  "answer": "C",
  "explanation": "Statement III links birds to reptiles, and Statement II links animals to birds. Since all mammals are animals, some reptiles are mammals through the chain. Similarly, some mammals are reptiles as reptiles include birds which are animals. Both conclusions follow."
}

  "topic": "Seating Arrangements (Linear, Circular)",
  "question": "There are eight people sitting around a circular table, facing the center. A is second to the left of B, who is directly opposite C. D is immediately to the right of E, and F is third to the right of G. H is sitting between E and F. If A and C swap places, and G and B swap places, who is sitting second to the right of the person directly opposite F?",
  "choices": ["A) A) E", "B) B) D", "C) C) H", "D) D) G"],
  "answer": "D",
  "explanation": "Original positions: A, E, H, F, G, B, C, D (clockwise). After swaps: C, E, H, F, A, B, D, G. F is at position 4. Opposite F is G (position 8). Second to the right of G is D."
}

  "question": "There are 8 people seated around a circular table, facing the center. A is seated second to the left of B, who is seated third to the right of C. If H moves two seats clockwise and D moves one seat counterclockwise, who is now seated immediately to the left of C?",
  "choices": ["A) F", "B) G", "C) H", "D) E"],
  "answer": "A",
  "explanation": "Original arrangement: C, A, B, D, E, F, G, H. After movement: H moves to position 3, D moves to position 5. New arrangement: C, G, H, A, D, E, F, B. C is at position 1, left of C is G."
}

  "choices": ["A) A) VV5", "B) B) VX5", "C) C) VV6", "D) D) VX6"],
  "answer": "B",

  "question": "There are seven people: A, B, C, D, E, F, and G, seated in a circle. A is seated between B and F. C is seated opposite D. E is seated two seats to the left of G.   "choices": ["A) C", "B) D", "C) E", "D) F"],
  "answer": "A",
  "explanation": "Original positions: A-B-E-G-F-D-C. After movement: A moves to position 3, B moves to position 5. Between A (pos 3) and G (pos 7) is C (pos 4)."
}

{
  "topic": "Seating Arrangements (Linear, Circular)",
  "question": "There are eight people seated around a circular table, with four facing the center and four facing outward. A is seated second to the left of B, who is directly opposite D. C is seated between E and F, with E facing outward. G is seated immediately to the right of H, who is facing outward. I is seated third to the right of J, who is facing the center. If all facing outward individuals rotate 180 degrees, who is now seated directly opposite A?",
  "choices": ["A) C", "B) E", "C) G", "D) J"],
  "answer": "C",
  "explanation": "After rotation, H faces center, G faces outward. A's original position is between B and C. After rotation, G is directly opposite A."
}
